title: 6 Dead, 10 Injured In Mexico Bar Gun Attack: Official
content: At least six people were killed and 10 others wounded early Sunday morning in an armed attack at a bar in the city of Villahermosa, in the southeastern Mexican state of Tabasco, local authorities said.
summary: At least six people were killed and 10 others wounded early Sunday morning in an armed attack at a bar in the city of Villahermosa, in the southeastern Mexican state of Tabasco, local authorities said.

title: "Need To Bring This To Responsible End": Key Trump Pick Over War In Ukraine
content: US President-elect Donald Trump's top security advisor called on Sunday for an end to the escalation of the war between Ukraine and Russia, and for both parties to come to the negotiating table.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump's top security advisor called on Sunday for an end to the escalation of the war between Ukraine and Russia, and for both parties to come to the negotiating table.

title: "Waited For 10 Hours": Germany Goes Nuts For Viral Pistachio Chocolate
content: When Ali Fakhro lays out a row of pistachio-filled chocolate bars in the morning at his bakery in Berlin, he knows they will be gone in a matter of hours.
summary: When Ali Fakhro lays out a row of pistachio-filled chocolate bars in the morning at his bakery in Berlin, he knows they will be gone in a matter of hours.

title: Philippines VP Threatens To Have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr Assassinated
content: The widening rift between the two most powerful political families in the Philippines became public after the Southeast Asian nation's Vice President Sara Duterte said that she would have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr assassinated.
summary: The widening rift between the two most powerful political families in the Philippines became public after the Southeast Asian nation's Vice President Sara Duterte said that she would have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr assassinated.

title: Uruguay Votes For Next President In Razor-Sharp Election
content: Voters in South America's laid-backUruguay, known for its beaches, legalized marijuana and stability, will head to the polls on Sunday in a second-round presidential race between moderates that closes out a bumper year of elections.
summary: Voters in South America's laid-backUruguay, known for its beaches, legalized marijuana and stability, will head to the polls on Sunday in a second-round presidential race between moderates that closes out a bumper year of elections.

title: Iran To Hold Nuclear Talks With European Powers: Report
content: Iran plans to hold talks about its disputed nuclear programme with three European powers on Nov. 29 in Geneva, Japan's Kyodo news agency reported on Sunday, days after the UN atomic watchdog passed a resolution against Tehran.
summary: Iran plans to hold talks about its disputed nuclear programme with three European powers on Nov. 29 in Geneva, Japan's Kyodo news agency reported on Sunday, days after the UN atomic watchdog passed a resolution against Tehran.

title: "Tolerance" Festival In Bangladesh Cancelled After Islamist Threats
content: A Bangladeshi mystic sect promoting religious tolerance has cancelled their popular music festival after Islamist threats, the latest victim of turbulent religious relations since a student-led August revolution.
summary: A Bangladeshi mystic sect promoting religious tolerance has cancelled their popular music festival after Islamist threats, the latest victim of turbulent religious relations since a student-led August revolution.

title: Penguin That Swam From Antarctica To Australia Released Back Into Ocean
content: Gus is believed to have swum thousands of kilometres, possibly carried off course by ocean currents.
summary: Gus is believed to have swum thousands of kilometres, possibly carried off course by ocean currents.

title: Australian Disney Star Removes Snake From Plane, Wins Over Passengers
content: Before the plane took off, a passenger alerted the crew to a snake on board, sparking panic.
summary: Before the plane took off, a passenger alerted the crew to a snake on board, sparking panic.

title: Horse Head, Body Of Pregnant Cow: Sicilian Mafia Recreates Godfather Scene
content: A building contractor in the Sicilian town of Altofonte discovered a severed horse head and a cow quartered with its bloodied dead calf on his property. The incident is being investigated as a possible mafia threat, CNN reported.
summary: A building contractor in the Sicilian town of Altofonte discovered a severed horse head and a cow quartered with its bloodied dead calf on his property. The incident is being investigated as a possible mafia threat, CNN reported.

title: Explained: The South China Sea Dispute And India's Stand On It
content: India has reiterated that it stands for freedom of navigation and overflight, unimpeded lawful commerce and adherence to international law for peace and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific.
summary: India has reiterated that it stands for freedom of navigation and overflight, unimpeded lawful commerce and adherence to international law for peace and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific.

title: Sea Nomads, Once Masters In Water, Now Forced To Abandon Oceanic Life
content: As the marine environment deteriorates due to climate change and overfishing, many Bajau Laut families are abandoning their houseboats in favour of stilt houses.
summary: As the marine environment deteriorates due to climate change and overfishing, many Bajau Laut families are abandoning their houseboats in favour of stilt houses.

title: 163 Kg Employee Sues Company For Over Rs 38 Crore, Says Desk Too Small
content: A New York Public Library employee, weighing 163 kg, has filed a lawsuit seeking $4.6 million in damages, alleging that being forced to work at an inadequately sized desk caused him physical and emotional trauma.
summary: A New York Public Library employee, weighing 163 kg, has filed a lawsuit seeking $4.6 million in damages, alleging that being forced to work at an inadequately sized desk caused him physical and emotional trauma.

title: 'Cursed' Emerald Set To Return To Brazil After Decades Long Legal Battle
content: After 24 years of legal battles spanning continents, the 'cursed' Bahia Emerald - a 397 kg pound gemstone reputed to be the world's largest - is finally set to return to Brazil.
summary: After 24 years of legal battles spanning continents, the 'cursed' Bahia Emerald - a 397 kg pound gemstone reputed to be the world's largest - is finally set to return to Brazil.

title: This Restaurant Serves World's Most Expensive Michelin Tasting Menu At...
content: While the visitors are served the best-tasting snow crab at the establishment, they must take off their shoes and sit on the floor.
summary: While the visitors are served the best-tasting snow crab at the establishment, they must take off their shoes and sit on the floor.

title: Islamabad Under Lockdown Ahead Of Massive Protest For Imran Khan's Release
content: Pakistan's capital was put under a security lockdown on Sunday ahead of protests by supporters of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan calling for his release.
summary: Pakistan's capital was put under a security lockdown on Sunday ahead of protests by supporters of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan calling for his release.

title: How Legal Threats On Benjamin Netanyahu Could Impact Israel-Hamas War
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faces legal perils at home and abroad that point to a turbulent future for the Israeli leader and could influence the wars in Gaza and Lebanon, analysts and officials say.
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faces legal perils at home and abroad that point to a turbulent future for the Israeli leader and could influence the wars in Gaza and Lebanon, analysts and officials say.

title: What Is 'Sledging', A Toxic Dating Trend That Gen Z Should Look Out For
content: This "cuffing season" has always been about finding a relationship for the winter, but in this case, it's not about genuine connection.
summary: This "cuffing season" has always been about finding a relationship for the winter, but in this case, it's not about genuine connection.

title: "Antisemitic Terrorist Act": Israel On Rabbi's Death In UAE
content: An Israeli man who went missing in the United Arab Emirates has been found murdered, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday, denouncing his death as a "heinous antisemitic terrorist act".
summary: An Israeli man who went missing in the United Arab Emirates has been found murdered, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday, denouncing his death as a "heinous antisemitic terrorist act".

title: Jay Bhattacharya Emerges As Trump's Top Pick To Head US Health Agency
content: Jay Bhattacharya, a Stanford University-trained physician and economist, has reportedly emerged as the presumptive favourite of President-elect Donald Trump's transition team for the post of next director of the National Institutes of Health (NIH).
summary: Jay Bhattacharya, a Stanford University-trained physician and economist, has reportedly emerged as the presumptive favourite of President-elect Donald Trump's transition team for the post of next director of the National Institutes of Health (NIH).
